repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The palm-leaf bundle, a composite manuscript, entitled Viratam Iraṇṭu on its additional title page, contains:

list.item: The Rāmatēvar Pūcāviti, "Rules for worship by Rāmatēvar", which appears to be a manual for worship by Rāmatēvar, in 200 stanzas. The text is complete. (Indien 4a).
The Nāṟkaraṇavupatēcam, "Teaching on the four karaṇams", which appears to be a lesson on the four karaṇams, that is, the four organs of perceptions. The text is complete. (Indien 4b).

supportDesc.condition: Excellent state of preservation, despite a few boreholes caused by insects.

collation.desc: the front cover. Shelfmarks on recto.
1 folio = title page. No foliation. Verso blank. Double leaf. Shelfmark on recto.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 4 (front cover, recto).
BnF bequest sticker DON N° (front cover, recto).
Shelfmark sticker (Société Asiatique?), written in black ink: 638 (front cover, recto).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: The bundle is dated to circa 1840 by Vinson (1867) and to 1840 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Indien 4a (f45r4) is dated to the year carvacittu of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1827-1828, 1767-1768, 1707-1708, etc.

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 2, no. 4.
Rosny, Léon de (1868). La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. (1866-). Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 1r, no. 4.

Vinson, Julien (1868). Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 1, no. 4. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
